p: Transitory colonization of the intestinal mucosa is another important criterion proposed by FAO/WHO guideline for selection of probiotic strains. In this study, the adhesion of L. fermentum strains BGSR163 and BGSR227 to Caco-2 intestinal epithelial cells (IEC) was investigated. Both strains exhibited the adherence ability to IEC in a range common for probiotic strains ( Sokovic Bajic et al., 2019), although the higher adhesion was scored in strain L. fermentum BGSR163 than in the strain L. fermentum BGSR227.
